p: Consultations with family members and neighbors were also a common cause of delay. Advice given was often using of herbs, contributing to delays in seeking appropriate care [ 18]. Culturally, grandmothers and mothers-in-law, particularly if paternal, hold a dominant position, to the extent that caregivers are obliged to follow advice, even if they disagree [ 18, 41]. Fathers were consulted, often times for financial support. However, in contrast to previous reports [ 44], involvement of fathers did not notably contribute to delays in care. Some caregivers reported having autonomy to make decisions in the absence of fathers or when dealing with an uncooperative father, demonstrating empowerment of some mothers [ 45].
